com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test

Class TestInputTopic<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.jukkakarvanen.kafka.streams.test.TestInputTopic<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the Kafka key
    V - the type of the Kafka value

    public class TestInputTopic<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    TestInputTopic is used to pipe records to topic in TopologyTestDriver. This class combines functionality of TopologyTestDriver and ConsumerRecordFactory. To use TestInputTopic create new class with topicName and correct Serdes or Serializers In actual test code, you can pipe new message values, keys and values or list of KeyValue without needing to pass serdes each time. You need to have own TestInputTopic object for each topic.

    Processing messages

    
     private TestInputTopic<String, String> inputTopic;
     ...
     inputTopic = new TestInputTopic<>(testDriver, inputTopic, new Serdes.StringSerde(), new Serdes.StringSerde());
     ...
     inputTopic.pipeInput("Hello");
    See Also:
    TopologyTestDriver, ConsumerRecordFactory

      • TestInputTopic

        public TestInputTopic(org.apache.kafka.streams.TopologyTestDriver driver,
                      java.lang.String topicName,
                      org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<K> keySerde,
                      org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Serde<V> valueSerde)
        Create a test input topic to pipe messages in. Uses current system time as start timestamp. Auto-advance is disabled.
        Parameters:
        driver - TopologyTestDriver to use
        topicName - the topic name used
        keySerde - the key serializer
        valueSerde - the value serializer

      • pipeInput

        public void pipeInput(K key,
                      V value,
                      org.apache.kafka.common.header.Headers headers)
        Send an input message with the given key, value and headers on the topic and then commit the messages. The timestamp will be generated based on the constructor provided start time and time will auto advance.
        Parameters:
        key - the record key
        value - the record value
        headers - the record headers

      • pipeInput

        public void pipeInput(K key,
                      V value,
                      org.apache.kafka.common.header.Headers headers,
                      long timestampMs)
        Send an input message with the given key, value, timestamp and headers on the topic and then commit the messages. Does not auto advance internally tracked time.
        Parameters:
        key - the record key
        value - the record value
        headers - the record headers
        timestampMs - the record timestamp

      • pipeKeyValueList

        public void pipeKeyValueList(java.util.List<org.apache.kafka.streams.KeyValue<K,V>> keyValues)
        Send input messages with the given KeyValue list on the topic then commit each message individually. The timestamp will be generated based on the constructor provided start time and time will auto advance.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - the list of KeyValue records

      • pipeKeyValueList

        public void pipeKeyValueList(java.util.List<org.apache.kafka.streams.KeyValue<K,V>> keyValues,
                             long startTimestamp,
                             long advanceMs)
        Send input messages with the given KeyValue list on the topic then commit each message individually. Does not auto advance internally tracked time.
        Parameters:
        keyValues - the list of KeyValue records
        startTimestamp - the timestamp for the first generated record
        advanceMs - the time difference between two consecutive generated records

      • pipeValueList
